item.title: Labels????
item.author: invalid@example.com (ross.clowser)
item.dc:creator: ross.clowser
item.content:encoded:
Hi All,

I just recorded a full length album and I am trying to figure out where to release it! It's based in jazz and improv, but it falls more in line with the modern, post-rock, sometimes experimental category - think Jeff Parker, Tortoise, a little bit Bad Plus, Alice Coltrane. I am looking at local labels: Shifting Paradigm, Aura Vortex, Innova, and wanted to see what folks' experience has been. What has releasing with a label done for you? Have you had to put up money for promotion...

Read more

item.title: Advice for working in music
item.author: invalid@example.com (nathanielm410)
item.dc:creator: nathanielm410
item.content:encoded:
I previously posted this in tcuboard2.0 but this site seems much more active so I thought I would move it here
Hey,

My name is Nathaniel I have been in the Twin Cities music scene for about a year now. I have loved being on stage as a drummer and am looking for another band to join, but I also have found a love for working behind the scenes for bands. I am young, but I have a good background in live sound, photography, and sales, which I think would all be beneficial in different ways...

Read more

item.title: Music Marketing/Ads
item.author: invalid@example.com (mrvron)
item.dc:creator: mrvron
item.content:encoded:
Hello Mr Vron here
I will help you plan your music marketing, video promotion, and help run ads study your data help define audience, at an affordable rate and budget.
Contact: Release@mrvron.com

item.title: SEEKING ADVICE: TAXES
item.author: invalid@example.com (laura.kiernan)
item.dc:creator: laura.kiernan
item.content:encoded:
hi everyone its tax season & i am overwhelmed. for the amount that my band made last year i need to issue 1099s to all my bandmates + file as a small business (schedule c). i know i'm past the deadline on issuing 1099s (didn't know there was a deadline until past the deadline lol). i'm thinking of either making an EIN number or LLC for next year. anyways, i think the cost of hiring an accountant is worth it over the hours of tears i have spent so far trying to figure this out on my own. does...

Read more

item.title: Local Merch Vendors
item.author: invalid@example.com (Rigel)
item.dc:creator: Rigel
item.content:encoded:
Helping out some friends who are planning upcoming tours down south and wondering if y'all have merch vendors you appreciate and want to shout out.
T-Shirts, posters, and stickers are things they are currently considering.

It would be great to collect local business contacts that support and are supported by local artists.
Thanks!

item.title: The Mess Tape
item.author: invalid@example.com (themessrecords)
item.dc:creator: themessrecords
item.content:encoded:
Hellloooooo lovely folk!

Wasn't sure where to post this BUT The Mess recently announced our most recent project "The Mess Tape", a various artists album written, composed, performed and recorded by Twin Cities music makers. this is a completely free recording opportunity that is open and available to all music of all sounds. for more info: itsthemess.com/opportunities/themesstape. we're accepting submissions until November 29th and are hoping put together a record that is as diverse...

Read more

item.title: Looking to borrow/rent a van or suv this Saturday!
item.author: invalid@example.com (alexschaaf)
item.dc:creator: alexschaaf
item.content:encoded:
Playing in Winona on Saturday and realized i need to borrow or rent a van/suv/minivan to get my lil band down there and back. Will be leaving Sat at 3pm ish and coming back after, so I could get it back to you Sunday morning/afternoon.

Let me know if you know of any leads, thanks!

item.title: Trans Affirming Heathcare
item.author: invalid@example.com (hayleedee)
item.dc:creator: hayleedee
item.content:encoded: Hello TCUP! I am turning towards this space to ask for help. I have a friend that is in search for a trans affirming primary care doctor. If you have mental heath resources or doctors you know of that fit this criteria your suggestions would be profoundly helpful.

item.title: Video Editing- Help!
item.author: invalid@example.com (SabrinaRose)
item.dc:creator: SabrinaRose
item.content:encoded:
Hey! I was wondering if anyone can point me in the right direction here... I've been playing around with taking videos on my digitals and am finding out once I get them onto my computer there is usually an issue with either the audio or brightness.

Is there a editing program that could help fix this? I'm familiar with Adobe programs like Photoshop and Lightroom.

Thanks in advance!

item.title: [REQUEST] Anyone have any (electric) guitars they aren't using much + I could borrow for a short time?
item.author: invalid@example.com (alexschaaf)
item.dc:creator: alexschaaf
item.content:encoded:
I need a new guitar vibe and would love to try out some different things, if anyone would be willing to lend something out for a short time! -

open to anything, but specifically --
  • something like a Gibson/Epiphone SG,
  • something like a Gretsch semi-hollowbody
  • Fender Jaguar or Jazzmaster
  • any other fun little guys

item.title: Pay-what-you-can/Free gear!
item.author: invalid@example.com (andrealeonardmusic)
item.dc:creator: andrealeonardmusic
item.content:encoded:
I am currently decluttering my apartment and I have a few music things I am getting rid of. If y'all wanted to give me some money for each item, that would be nice, but I'd rather have this stuff out of my space over getting money for this stuff. Let me know if you want anything and I'll bring it to the next TCUP meeting!

  • Acoustic guitar humidifier
  • sustain pedal for electric piano/keyboard
  • violin shoulder rest (3/4 to 4/4 size)
  • Boss distortion pedal (doesn't work, but feel...

Read more

item.title: Van share?
item.author: invalid@example.com (alexschaaf)
item.dc:creator: alexschaaf
item.content:encoded: Post here if you HAVE a van you'd be willing to lend/rent/etc, or if you're looking for one!

item.title: September weeklong tour - seeking advice!!
item.author: invalid@example.com (laura.kiernan)
item.dc:creator: laura.kiernan
item.content:encoded:
Hi friends!! Saw Peter's vent, just huge bummer with Eau Claire I'm sorry it didn't feel good, though the videos still were super awesome @PETER M !

I'm currently planning a small (~1 week or so) midwest tour. We're definitely going to hit Chicago, Milwaukee, and Madison. Was planning on Eau Claire too but I'm more turned off hearing Peter's experience. Where do you feel are better alternative cities? Looking around Minnesota, Wisconsin, and Iowa mostly

item.title: [request] Go Pro camera
item.author: invalid@example.com (PETER M)
item.dc:creator: PETER M
item.content:encoded: I’m not sure if they’re all waterproof but Im looking for one that is waterproof

item.title: [REQUEST] fisherman or something similar!
item.author: invalid@example.com (laura.kiernan)
item.dc:creator: laura.kiernan
item.content:encoded: Hi TCUP!!! I got looped into a last minute house show for my friend whose venue gig got dropped last minute due to other bands having covid Anyways curious if anyone would have a fisherman or a similar small PA to use tomorrow (7/19) for vocals? Thank you!!

item.title: [TO LEND] Studio microphones - SM7, Fathead ribbon, pair of Rode NT5s
item.author: invalid@example.com (alexschaaf)
item.dc:creator: alexschaaf
item.content:encoded:
None of these are super high end, but might be helpful.

Shure SM7B (for short periods of time, this is the one i use most regularly)

Cascade Fathead II (one)
Rode NT5 (two)

item.title: [TO LEND] Guitar amps - Fender Blues Jr and a Peavey Classic 30
item.author: invalid@example.com (alexschaaf)
item.dc:creator: alexschaaf
item.content:encoded: Both in good condition!

item.title: [TO LEND] Fender Precision bass (1977)
item.author: invalid@example.com (alexschaaf)
item.dc:creator: alexschaaf
item.content:encoded: This is in great shape and a very solid bass, I just don't use it all the time so happy to lend out (if you protect it like it's your own child)--

item.title: [TO LEND] Electric guitars (Fender Tele and a 'Mustang-type')
item.author: invalid@example.com (alexschaaf)
item.dc:creator: alexschaaf
item.content:encoded: The Tele Thinline is made in Mexico (not one of the super high end models), and the Snafu is a Mustang-like custom guitar that I really like, it's pretty middy / sort of dark / nasally, packs a punch.
